sentence.idiomatic: Wow, that young lady really has an air about her.
You've got that way about you, everything you wear looks good.
She has a kind of noble way about her. I was attracted by her way.
His son is a really good student. He is a graduate student now.
After finishing graduate school I went to work at that company.
This position has an educational requirement; you must be a graduate student.
Tonight there is a magic show. Let's go watch it together.
She has been good at performing ever since she was young--she was born with the grace of a movie star.
I've heard that you can really dance. How about you give everyone a performance?
You've been getting made up for a long time already; if we don't go now, we're going to be late.
You're already so grown up, you should learn how to dress yourself up a little.
She is going to attend an important ball, so she dressed up especially beautiful.
Before mom did everything; now I must do every single thing for myself.
Here we have all kinds of things to eat or drink. You don't need to go out and buy anything.
Singing, dancing, drawing--I want to study them all.
After seeing this movie, what thoughts do you have on it?
Everyone that heard this story all had the same impression--they were all very moved.
Can you tell us about your thoughts on attending this beauty pageant?
Even without make-up you still look good.
She went to the washroom to put on make-up. She'll be here in a moment.
You look like a movie star when you're all made up.
I'm new. Please give me lots of advice about work matters.
The director is looking for a fresh face to act in this movie.
We don't plan on employing a new person for this position.
She is not considered a beauty around these parts. There are a lot of women prettier than her.
What kind of a man are you? You can't lift this little thing?
When it comes to computers, he is considered to be an expert. If your computer has a problem, feel free to ask him.
Excuse me, is this the Miss Blogger sign up?
Yes. Line up over there.
Hey, look. That girl is quite pretty.
Yeah, rather refined, and with a decent figure. How about chatting with her?
All right! ... There are a lot of people signing up. We've been waiting for over an hour already.
Really? Then I'm going to be late for class.
You're still a student?
Yeah, a graduate student. My name is Liu Jia.
I'm Monica. This is my friend, Jessica.
Are you students too?
Yeah, we both study theater. What major are you?
Chinese.
So why would you participate in a beauty pageant?

Yeah. We study acting, and the school even teaches us how to put on make-up. Plus we have to study performing, singing, dancing, and all that. It comes in handy for a beauty pageant. It seems that learning Chinese just isn't of any use.

I used to think that way. But I never imagined that for Miss Blogger the most important thing is the blog content. Everything I write is about the thoughts of a twenty-something girl. Even boys like to read it.
Same with my blog. I teach how to apply make-up, and how to dress!
Me too, the same goes for my blog. Last month we both won new blogger awards. Were you in that competition?

No. I've had my blog for over two years, so I'm not a newcomer. But this time it's a beauty pageant plus blogging, so maybe I am a newcomer there. You two must have a lot of experience. I have to learn a lot from you.

word.literal: refinement; the way a person has about them
three women make enough for a drama

character.pinyin: sān ge nǚrén yī tái xì
